member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.BenchmarksScanner
member.summary: Scans a type and extracts benchmarks information.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.BenchmarksScanner.Container
member.summary: The benchmarks container reference.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.BenchmarksScanner.Init
member.summary: The benchmarks init reference, if available.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.BenchmarksScanner.Benchmarks
member.summary: The benchmark references, if any.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.ParametersSet
member.summary: Identifies a set of property-value pair to be applied to a benchmarks container.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.ParametersSetCollection
member.summary: Identifies a collection of parameters set. When iterated, returns all the permutations of the properties with their values.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Analysis.PropertyWithParametersCollection
member.summary: Identifies a property decorated with with a . It can return an enumerator of the param values defined in the attribute.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.ArgumentsAttribute
member.summary: Defines the benchmark arguments when the method accepts input values. The type and the number of arguments must be coherent with what the method expects.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.ArgumentsAttribute.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Defines the collection of arguments.
member.param: The method's arguments.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarkAttribute
member.summary: Identifies a benchmark method.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarkAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the benchmark that will be used in the reports: if not set, the name of the method will be used.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarkAttribute.Iterations
member.summary: Defines how many iterations this benchmark will run, given the same parameters and arguments. This must be a positive value, and has a default of 1. Increasing the iterations may increase the accuracy of the results.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarkAttribute.Order
member.summary: Defines the order by which the benchmark should run against the other benchmarks contained in the same container. The lower the value, the earlier the benchmark will be invoked.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarkAttribute.Baseline
member.summary: Defines if this benchmark will be used as a baseline for comparing the other benchmarks contained in the same container. Only one benchmark per container can be a baseline.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarksContainerAttribute
member.summary: Defines additional information about the class that contains the benchmarks.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.BenchmarksContainerAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the benchmarks container that will be used in the reports: if not set, the class name will be used.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.InitAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an initialization method to be executed before each benchmark in the container.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.InitContainerAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an initialization method to be executed once before every benchmark.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.InitWithAttribute
member.summary: Identifies an initialization method to be executed before the benchmark. This attribute is meant to be applied to a benchmark method.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.InitWithAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: An initialization method's name.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.InitWithAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Identifies an initialization method.
member.param: The initialization method's name.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.ParamAttribute
member.summary: Defines all the possible values of a property that will be used by all the benchmarks.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.ParamAttribute.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Defines all the possible values of a property.
member.param: The property values that will be used by the benchmarks in the same container.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.WarmupWithAttribute
member.summary: Identifies a warm-up method to be executed before the benchmark. This attribute is meant to be applied to a benchmark method. The time the warm-up method takes to executed won't be mixed with the actual benchmark's time, and it will be stored in a dedicated variable.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.WarmupWithAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: The name of the warm-up method for this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.WarmupWithAttribute.Order
member.summary: Defines the order by which the wamu-up method should run against the other warm-up methods for this benchmark.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.Attributes.WarmupWithAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Identifies a warm-up method to be executed before the benchmark.
member.param: The warm-up method's name.

member.summary: Appends the text to the export prefixed with the defined .

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.IBenchmarkOutput
member.summary: A benchmark-aware facade used to handle benchmark's logs.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.IBenchmarkOutput.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a new line with the log message, if the configuration enables it.
member.param: The log message.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput
member.summary: The main implementation used internally by the library to output execution logs. It supports the definition of the indent level, in order to format a series of related logs.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput.#ctor(TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel)
member.summary: Creates a new instance given the max output level defined by the configuration.
member.param: The max output level.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput.IsShown(TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel)
member.summary: Checks the level against the max output level defined by the configuration: returns true when a log with the given level can be sent to the output.
member.param: The log level to evaluate.
member.returns: true if a log with the given level can be sent to the output; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput.TinyBenchmark#IBenchmarkOutput#WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a new line with the log message with a Verbose level. This method is invoked by the benchmarks.
member.param: The log message.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput.WriteLine(TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a new line with the log message with the given log, if the configuration allows it.
member.param: The log message.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkOutput.ProgressFor(TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a with the log configuration of this instance.
member.param: The output level that the progress will write logs with.
The total items that the execution tracked by this writer will process.
The length of the text progress bar, in characters.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.ProgressWriter
member.summary: Writes a text progress bar.

member.name: M:TinyBenchmark.ProgressWriter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Action{System.String},System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The total items that the execution tracked by this writer will process.
A delegate that handles the progress message.
The character used to identify the progress.
The character used to identify the remaining work.
The length of the text progress bar, in characters.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel
member.summary: Defines which kind of logs should be displayed during execution.

member.name: F:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel.Silent
member.summary: No logs.

member.name: F:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel.ErrorsOnly
member.summary: Only logs indicating errors.

member.name: F:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel.Minimal
member.summary: Logs with minimal information about the execution.

member.name: F:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel.Normal
member.summary: Informative logs with information about the steps of the execution.

member.name: F:TinyBenchmark.OutputLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Rich logs with many details about the steps of the execution.

member.name: T:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport

member.summary: The name of this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.StartedAtUtc
member.summary: The UTC time of when this benchmark started.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.Duration
member.summary: The total duration of this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.InitDuration
member.summary: The duration of the initialization.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.Warmup
member.summary: The duration of the warm-up.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.AvgIterationDuration
member.summary: The average duration of all the iterations of this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.IsBaseline
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this benchmark was marked as a baseline for comparing the other benchmarks in the same container.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.BaselineStats
member.summary: The comparison data against the baseline benchmark's results. It's null when there was no baseline benchmark or when this is the baseline benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.IterationReports
member.summary: The reports of the iterations of this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.AppliedParameters
member.summary: The parameters that were applied to the container right before running this benchmark.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.SuccessfulIterations
member.summary: The number of successful iterations.

member.name: P:TinyBenchmark.BenchmarkReport.Exception
member.summary: The exceptions thrown during the execution of this benchmark.

member.summary: Indicates whether or not this benchmark had any exceptions.
